content: Responsible for the quality and completeness of data in core systems by performing and overseeing the auditing of data Gathering requirements, developing, validating, and maintaining reports for internal and external stakeholders, while ensuring consistency and accuracy Ensure the timeliness and accuracy of internal and external report deliverables Manage scheduled and ad hoc reporting needs of the organization Execute and manage the completion of large reconciliation tasks and analytical projects Oversee large systems and data related projects and collaborate with cross-functional departments to develop and implement improved reporting, data workflows and processes Lead and execute complex data related analytical projects to drive business decisions and efficiencies Qualifications Bachelor degree in Computer Science or IT 2+ years of Data Analysis, Data Modeling Experience in Microsoft Dynamic NAV ERP Proven experience of an end to end implementation process from business analysis to end report delivery Fluency in English (verbal and written communication) Knowledge of various data mining, reporting, and reconciliation tools and methodologies Systems and software knowledge in R orand Python, SQL Analysis Services, GIS, Data Mining Experience working with diverse business groups within a matrix environment If you are willing to learn new technologies you can work well both independently and within a team, being detail and process oriented, this is an opportunity you do not want to miss!

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all We are excited to announce the launch of our new EY offices in Patras and are inviting young graduates and experienced professionals from Patras and the wider Western Greece region to join our dynamic consulting team. We are a leader in consulting services and are seeking individuals with the right mix of skill, enthusiasm and curiosity that want an opportunity to enhance their knowledge and develop professionally within a truly global organization. The opportunity Modern technology produces more data than ever before, but also provides the tools to store, organize, analyze and share this data, resulting in new opportunities and substantiated business insights in support of new and deeper insights and more informed decision making. EY delivers leading services and solutions in the area of big data, business intelligence and data engineering built on a blend of tools and custom-developed methods. As part of our Data and Analytics team of the Technology Consulting practice, you will work with multi-disciplinary teams to support clients in a wide range of data initiatives aiming to generate and present new, useful and actionable insights. You will have the opportunity to work and take responsibilities in challenging engagements, gaining exposure to clients in various sectors both in Greece and abroad. Your key responsibilities Participation in large-scale client engagements. Contribution towards, or even leading delivery of innovative and engaging data engineering solutions. Understanding of business and technical requirements, provision of subject matter expertise and implementation of data engineering techniques. Conducting of data discovery activities, performing root cause analysis, and making recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues. Putting good organizational and time management skills into practice, with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple complex projects under tight deadlines. To qualify for the role, you must have A BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or other related, quantitative fields. Advanced SQL skills Knowledge and experience in PowerBI Ideally, you’ll also have: Relevant professional experience. What we look for Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills. Desire to investigate and try-out new tools and technologies as they are released. Ability to work under tight timelines, in cases for multiple project deliveries. Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively within high-performing teams. Confidence to convey technical advice and guidance to clients. Advanced technical writing skills in Greek and English (additional languages a plus). Evidence of self-motivation for continuous development. What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our rewards package includes a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.Plus, we offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. It yours to build. #betterworkingworld

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. The opportunity We are excited to announce the launch of our new EY offices in Patras and are inviting young graduates and experienced professionals from Patras and the wider Western Greece region to join our dynamic consulting team. We are a leader in consulting services and are seeking individuals with the right mix of skill, enthusiasm and curiosity that want an opportunity to enhance their knowledge and develop professionally within a truly global organization. You will gain experience working with our Technology Consulting practice, which is a leading provider of services to large organizations of all industries. Being part of our Data & Analytics Center of Excellence, you will work with multi-disciplinary and international teams, in a multicultural and fast- paced environment. You will build your skills in Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence through multifaceted training to develop applications with diverse real-world datasets. You will solve the business world most challenging problems alongside experienced professionals and subject matter experts. Your key responsibilities You will identify appropriate modeling techniques to answer the most critical business questions and use your analysis to infer business insights in support of your clients’ decision making. You will also resort to various data management and visualization techniques to provide insight into the data. Your portfolio of skills will cover a range of advanced statistical and machine learning techniques for classification, prediction, recommendation, clustering, forecasting, as well as data management, data visualization, and optimization, applied in a commercial context. You will contribute to presentations of modeling results and project proposals. Skills and attributes for success Strong communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills in English for both technical and business audiences. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills. Ability to work under tight timelines for multiple project deliveries. Abilityflexibility to travel and work abroad for international projects. To qualify for the role, you must have Excellent academic background, including a BSc or a MSc degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Engineering, Operational Research, Computer Science, or another related field with strong quantitative focus. Mathematical understanding of machine learning, predictive modeling and optimization algorithms 1 year of relevant professional, academic or research experience in some of the following: MLNLP tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, caret etc. Coding and software engineering in mainstream programming languages, such as Python or Go. Statistical packages for data manipulation and in development of predictive and prescriptive models (e.g. R, SAS, SPSS). Data analysis and manipulation of large datasets using e.g. SQL, spark. What we look for What most important is that you’re dedicated to working with your colleagues as part of a high-performing team. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm, high motivation and passion to develop fast in a multinational working environment. You’ll need to thrive in picking up new skills and talents as you go, so natural curiosity, a lot of questions and the confidence to speak up when you see something that could be improved are essential. If you’ve got the right combination of technical knowledge and communication skills, this role is for you. What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our rewards package includes a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.Plus, we offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! Are you passionate about working with data? Are you a hands-on professional interested in how insight can transform Business and Data Governance? PeopleCert currently looking for a Data Engineer . The Business Intelligence & Big Data (BIBD) team is responsible for the organization of management and operational information, by developing the corporate data warehouse, corporate data lake, cubes for self-service reporting, BI reports, and advanced analytics deliverables. Being a team within the Data Management Office, we also contribute to the coordination data governance, data quality and master data management activities across the organization. As a Data Engineer, your tasks will include the following: Contribute to the design and implementation of data factory pipelines (ELT workloads) Populate the corporate data lake from various source systems (including MS Dynamics CRM, MS Dynamics NAV, and in-house developed software applications) Contribute to the implementation of SSIS ETL workflows to populate the corporate data warehouse. If desired, contribute to BI data models, BI reports, and data science deliverables. Carry out any reasonably allocated duties and tasks, relevant to the role and the scope of activities by applying a flexible and adaptable customer centric approach to serve PEOPLECERT multinational presence and global operations across multiple time zones What we look for: Minimum 4 years working experience in big data workloads, leveraging Microsoft Azure technologies (e.g. Azure Data Lake, Data Lake, Databricks) Undergraduate and graduate degrees combining knowledge on the areas of Computer Science and Business Management. Excellent command of the English language (C2 level certification desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be a plus) Experience in data warehousing workloads using ETL technologies (e.g. Data Factory Pipelines) and solid T-SQL skills. Experience in data-related programming languages (SQL, Spark ,Python, etc) Experience in SSAS tabular or in Power BI data modeling is optional, includes DAX. Optional exposure to data science work, Python Jupyter notebooks, Databricks. Strong commitment to quality and delivery timelines, proactive, team player. What we offer: Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment Constant personal and professional development 100% Virtual Hiring Process If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you! About PeopleCert PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions. Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do. Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business. Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs) Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record andor bankruptcy must be declared. If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include: A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence) HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC) Financial background check Employment reference check If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality. #LI-Hybrid

Your main duties will be: Analyze business requirements, design and develop architectures for business intelligence implementations in Power BI or other tools that may be defined during the course of projects Take ownership of the software development process for BI projects Manage and correlate data from various sources (both SQL and NoSQL) Work for MDM, Central Reporting and BI solutions, translating business and data requirements into appropriate ETL orchestration and reporting Data Marts model requirements, as well to BI and analytics solutions by designing and implementing friendly dashboards Understand data lifecycle, data governance, lineage, catalog and quality and work to identify, design, and implement internal process improvements by automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, refactoring current architecture, etc. Ensure business analysis is done with an end-to-end business process perspective in mind – most of the time this will concern analysis of data across Data sources like MDM, CRM and ERP systems Create technical knowledge documentation and standards for data asset security, lifecycle & retention architecture Create and maintain data maps and systems interrelationship diagrams for data domains and systems Work with source platform andor integration layer data engineering teams to prepare data, derive metric calculations, etc. Conduct data discovery activities, perform root cause analysis, and make recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues Train, mentor and consult other team members, both on a technical level and on reporting best practices By joining Netcompany - Intrasoft , a leading IT company, you will be part of a hub of 1.700+ tech enthusiasts in Greece. You will work usingcutting-edgetechnologies that contribute to the design and delivery of solutions and products forchallenging, large-scale IT projects, that affect the lives of millions of citizens around the globe. Qualifications If you have A BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or other related, quantitative fields Solid work experience as a Data Engineer Proven (project experience) ability to design and develop PowerBI architecture Experience with Power BI (including Dax and M), relational SQL and NoSQL databases Oracle BI experience will be considered a plus Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills Team building skills and ability to guide junior team members Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment Excellent command of the English language (written & verbal) Advanced technical writing skills …then this position is suitable for you! It would also be a plus if you had Self-starter with excellent time management and project management skills who works professionally and autonomously, and takes ownership to deliver a successful project Excellent communicator with organizational skills and strong attention to detail Able to manage multiple priorities and assess & adjust quickly to changing priorities A true team-player but also someone who can work independently This position comes with Competitive compensation packages Continuous learning (with the most modern methods - unlimited access to Udemy for Business), andfast career growth Interesting and challenging tasks within large-scale projects An internationaldynamic within a fast-pacedworking environment The opportunity to work in a diverse environment with talented colleagues

Be a part of a revolutionary change At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to deliver a smoke-free future. With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions. PMI journey to a smoke-free future is fuelled by technology. The total transformation we’re going through means that there are unique projects here to match all levels of skills and ambitions – from pace-setting global pilot projects to vital local updates. Whether you want to pursue a personal passion or build an international career, there space here to develop in any number of directions. To join us you’ll need to be driven and equally happy whether you’re taking the strategic view or diving deep into processes. We'll make sure you're set up to succeed whatever your project is, our culture is agile and collaborative, and we genuinely believe our people are some of the best you’ll ever work with. We are currently looking for talented individuals who excel in data analytics and are passionate to analyse large amounts of raw information, aiming to improve the IQOS Consumer Journey. Key part of the role is to identify predictive actions, synthesise the analysis into business insights and drive impactful decision making! Your ‘day to day’ -Use statistical methods in large databases and unstructured datasets to identify different milestones of IQOS consumer journey -Build multiple customer segmentation for acquisition and retention strategies -Leverage data to find business opportunities and develop creative solutions by employing data science methods such as statistical models, machine learning, pattern recognition, optimization algorithms or other complex methodologies -Model and predict future behavior of IQOS customers, develop and analyze relevant experiments -Distil real-time 360 consumer data and turn them into insights that will foster fast business action -Connect data from different data source, leverage on a broad set of different metrics, synthesize and extract meaningful outcomes -Visualize dissimilar data and communicate them in a sharp and vivid manner across different stakeholders Who we’re looking for -Educational background in Maths, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline or equivalent experience (MSc or PhD degree will be considered an asset) -2-3 years of hands-on experience in Data Science or Applied Statistics for business problem solving (Descriptive, Exploratory, Predictive) such as segmentation, propensity modelling (churncross-sell), time-series forecasting, text analytics, etc. -Proficiency in R or Python. Knowledge of SAS will be considered as an asset -Good knowledge of relational databases and SQL is mandatory -Experimental design experience -Familiarization with at least one BI suite -Experience with exploratory data analysis, testing and modelling -Strong visualization and communication skills -Strong business acumen, analytical and problem-solving skills What we offer Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can: -Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore. -Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world best people and feel like you belong. -Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress. -Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.

The Loyalty Data Analyst will be part of the BI, Loyalty and Analytics department of AB. Heshe will be part of the Data & Analytics team where the candidate would get the opportunity to analyze and combine various large datasets in order to produce reports and visualizations that would assist in deriving meaningful insights to assist in overall data-driven decision making across the organization. The position requires a person that will be able to easily collaborate and communicate efficiently with cross-functional internal and external partners and genuinely commit to increase the adoption of self-service reporting to all relevant stakeholders. What you will focus on • Develop and deliver new reportsdashboards in order to provide ongoing insights to business stakeholders with analysis and interpretation of quantitative information • Gather business reporting requirements across departments • Conduct ad-hoc and ongoing business performance analysis • Perform customer analytics such as customer segmentations and targeted campaigns evaluation • Support team in ongoing improvements of data management including integration of new analytics tools and data sources and also assist in acceptance testing • Be part of an agile team that contributes actively to the ongoing digital transformation and innovation of the company, especially in the area of analytics Who we are looking for • BachelorMaster degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, etc. • Understanding of BI tools, databases and reporting models • Competent use of Power BI (1-2 years of experience) - Power Query  Data Modelling  DAX  Data Visualization • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Office 365 tools Your Value • Ability to troubleshoot and solve numerical and technical problems • Detail oriented with good problem-solving skills • Able to present complex data in easy-to-understand manner • Actively improves technical knowledge through self-learningformal training and have willingness to learn • Be able to discuss using both Business and IT language and terminology • Good communication skills both Greek and English Start your retail journey and live our values of care, teamwork, humor, integrity and courage Apply on line at www.abcareers.gr quoting reference: (ref: LDA_22 ) We care for you • Room to grow and develop via numerous opportunities for learning, professional development and career advancement • A safe and healthy workplace and a friendly environment which respects each employee individuality and personality • Member of Ahold Delhaize A place where everyone belongs We strive to be a better place to work where our associates reflect the markets we serve, where their voices are heard and valued, they find purpose in their work, and can grow and contribute to their fullest. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicantsemployees will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Certified by Diversity Charter Greece and SHARE Equality Label We Give the Best of our Self to make the Best in People Lives #giaolaosanoiazesai All applications are treated with utmost confidentiality

This position requires a strong command of data architecture, data processing and deployment techniques, as well as a demonstrated practical ability to determine where to invest time, synthesize actionable findings across diverse assignments, and present these findings to an audience with varying levels of background in analytics. What you will focus on Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databasesdata systems Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Identify and acquire necessary data from multiple sources and organizeclean the information to enhance operational data quality Implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality Discover opportunities for data acquisition Automate interdependent data pipelines What we are looking for Minimum 2 years of data engineering experience business data analyst BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize demanding workload Self-motivated, self- organised individual, able to work independently If you are interested in the position, please submit your CV at careersgr@delfipartners.com and quote the reference number DP-DA-04. Applications to Delfi Partners &  are treated with strict confidentiality.

In Kotsovolos, a member of Currys group, we believe in everything you have to offer. That why here, you will find a company that focuses on technology and innovation, but first of all believes and seeks the continuous development of its 2.800 people. In numbers! 94 stores, 2 modern training centers and more than 50.000 hours of training per year, dedicated to our people. Our goal? To plan for tomorrow and be the first ones who bring new technologies that will make our lives better. Join us and be part of the evolution! The Role The Senior Data Scientist drives new data insights to uncover business opportunities & revenue streams. The role has a firm understanding of statistics and data visualization (with BI team) for communication, as well as an understanding business growth areas & how to utilize important data. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for building data analytics models and surface key insights utilizing analytics tools, techniques and languages Develops end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools with BI team Performs solutioning and develops end to end Data Science projects. Responsible for creating required datasets and developing model specifications Carries out quality assurance testing to ensure the models deliver insights accurately Collaborates with BUs to review data sources, data inconsistencies, and business logic for initiating data discovery Visualizes and reports data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization The ideal candidate should have: Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar field; a Master is a plus Minimum 3 years of working experience in Data Science role Strong Experience in statistical modeling with focus in: Predictive ModellingClassification, Segmentation, Recommendation Engines, NLP, Forecasting Strong Knowledge of PythonR in Databricks with 3+years of practical experience Basic knowledge of Power BI Reporting & Data visualization Certifications is a plus: Azure AI Fundamentals & Azure Data Scientist Experience with Agile and SCRUM processes and methodologies is a plus Good communication skills What the company offers Continuous training in new technologies and tools Career development and growth opportunities Competitive bonus scheme, performance-based Group health medical insurance package Discounts on our company products New, modern and pleasant HQs workplace Hybrid work model Internal wellbeing actions In Kotsovolos, we are fully committed to embracing diversity, empowering uniqueness and preventing discrimination. And we make that commitment an action, as an Equal Opportunity Employer and a proud signatory member of the Diversity Charter Greece, an initiative of the European Commission to promote diversity in the Greek workplace. Because our team doesn’t focus on Race, Color, National Origin, Ethnicity, Gender, Age, Disability, Sexual Orientation and Religion.

Oversees the deployment of data and ML pipelines. Works with data scientists for the productionalization  automation using Spark packages of any new pipelines. The ideal candidate should have : Minimum 1+ years of experience in SQL, Python Basic knowledge in Microsoft Azure Stack (Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Devops ) and Big data development technologies (e.g. Spark) Basic Experience in Devops, CICD and Git Experience with programming languages to design, develop and implement ML algorithms Basic Statistics knowledge and experience in Analytics Data Science frameworks and principles Degree in Computer Science, IT, or similar field; a Master is a plus Data engineering certification (e.g Azure Certified dp-900) is a plus Experience with Agile and SCRUM processes and methodologies is nice to have. Data Engineer Responsibilities Identify data sources Collect data and source missing data Organize data into usable formats and analyze them to find answers to specific questions Set up data infrastructure Develop, implement and maintain databases Assess quality of data and remove or clean data Generate information and insights from data sets and identify trends and patterns Prepare reports for executive and project teams Create visualizations of data Create live dashboards Requirements 2+ years of experience as a Data Engineer Experience with Python, R , Hadoop Experience with a BI front-end (Tableau, SAP BW) and data warehouse system (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) Experience with SQL based and No SQL based technologies Strong documentation skills Ability to quickly analyze a complex problem and conduct detailed analysis Experience in the configuration and implementation of a data governance solutions such as Master Data Governance tool SAP MDG, Collibra, Informatica etc, will be considered an advantage Excellent written and verbal communication skills Bachelor Degree in relevant field Fluency in English

WATT+VOLT is one of the largest energy providers in Greece. Electricity, natural gas and the wide range of integrated services and energy saving solutions that offers to the end consumer are what make the organization the most innovative energy provider. Holding an Electricity Trading and Supply License in the Greek market since 2011, whereas in 2015 also obtained the Natural Gas Supply License. Thanks to the constant investments in innovative technologies and in the specialization of human resources, WATT+VOLT enjoys a dominant position in the trading and supply of electricity, in the trading of greenhouse gas emission allowance and in energy efficiency solutions with the Internet Of Things (IoT) technology in Greece. WATT+VOLT driving force is its people. Connect with us to imagine and do more together for a better future . Click here to learn more about our WATTVOLTers! We are currently seeking a highly talented and team-spirited individual to work as Senior ΒΙ & Data Engineer. Responsibilities Managing & documenting master data, identifying and analyzing data sources, assessing & improving data quality of enterprise datasets, developing & troubleshooting complex data flows and blueprinting data & application integration solutions Design & implement BIDWH projects to cover the Business Intelligence & Reporting requirements Design, Build, Test and Deploy advanced ETL processes to export and transform enterprise data Understanding business needs, communicating with key stakeholders, analyzing business requirements, proposing, agreeing and delivering BI and Reporting solutions Leverage standard tools to implement, schedule and manage data flows (sync, async, ad-hoc, batch, event based etc.) with comprehensive documentation of related artifacts Work closely with our software development team to prioritize information and integration needs across projects Requirements Bachelor degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, or other relevant title 5+ years experience in: MS SSIS and or Talend Open Studio database modeling, implementation and tuning using MSSQL. Reporting and Data Visualization tools, especially Power BI and Reporting Services 2+ years hands on with business process modeling and automation Good Knowledge of DAX language Familiar with Azure platform Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Excellent Greek and very good knowledge of English Nice to have skills Streaming and big data analysis, managing effectively large data sets Working experience with Integromat and Power Automate Process oriented with great documentation skills

Volton Hellenic Energy SA is a Greek company that is dynamically active and is increasing its capacity rapidly in the field of Electricity Supply and Trading, in the Gas Energy Sector and soon enough in the field of Telecommunications. By offering reliable services that meet the ever-growing energy needs of businesses and households, Volton aims to build solid and trustful relationships with its consumers. The company's ambition is to become one of the most important companies in the industry and remain at the forefront of developments in electricity and gas supply. The company will enter soon the Telecommunication sector aiming to expand more the portfolio of services. As part of its development, Volton strengthens its human resources in Athens and seeks: Senior Mobile Data Engineer Position responsibilities: Design, development and operation of the network supporting the mobile broadband services Evaluation and selection of technological solutions for the provision of mobile broadband services Development and operation of interconnections with other national, international and Internet upstream providers Management of suppliers and subcontractors who provide products and services for the Mobile broadband service network. Specification and documentation of engineering, operations and change management procedures for the network and the mobile broadband services Specification and monitoring of network performance and quality indicators.Preparation of reports 2nd level support for network and subscribers’ problems Necessary skills: Excellent knowledge and experience in the use of technologies and protocols for the provision of mobile broadband services Excellent knowledge of 4G EPC & 5G Core architectures and experience in the engineering and operation of their functional elements (MME, PGW, PCEFPCRF etc.) Excellent knowledge of protocols used in mobile broadband architectures (DiameterRadius, GTP etc.), as well as IP addresses management and authentication protocols Excellent knowledge of switching and routing protocols in IP networks (IPv4IPv6, BGP, OSPF, MPLSEoMPLS, VLAN etc.) Knowledge of Cloud & Virtualization (NFV) technologies Necessary qualifications: At least 8 years of experience in network technology projects related to the provision of Mobile Broadband services, ideally in a Telecommunications Service Provider or a related Technology vendor University Degree or relevant, in Engineering  Technology  Informatics direction Experience in managing large-scale technology projects Experience in telecommunication service provider interconnections projects Excellent analytical and communication skills Fluency in English Related Technology certifications will be considered an asset The company offers: Competitive remuneration package Private insurance Corporate benefits & perks Continuous training and professional development Excellent professional environment Modern and productive working facilities All applications will be treated with confidentiality. If your CV meets the requirements of the job, we will contact you by phone to schedule an appointment. Information about the Group on our site volton.gr

We currently have a vacancy position for a Data Engineer - Spark Developer to join our expanding development teams. Tasks Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve data integration pipeline; Develop pipeline objects using Apache Spark  Pyspark  Python or Scala; Design and develop data pipeline architectures using Azure Databricks, Spark, and related Azure Services. Mandatory Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering; Strong analytical skills, team - and quality-oriented, keen to learn and excel; Thorough knowledge of Apache Spark; Experience as a Data Engineer; Advanced knowledge of Python or Scala; Spark query tuning and performance optimization; Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) Fluency in verbal and written English. Benefits As a Data Engineer - Spark Developer , you will have the opportunity to explore and apply the latest development toolstechnologies. You will be integrated into a friendly team and work closely with the backend developers and business analysts to deliver high-quality applications. Belonging to an international company, you will contribute to challenging IT software projects for major international public organizations and institutions. The complexity and size of the projects and our methodological approach are the best basis for developing your skills and your career. We offer competitive remuneration based on qualifications and experience, including: Competitive full-time salary; Private Health Coverage on the  group program; Flexible working hours, top - of - the Line tools, language courses, specialized trainings; A great opportunity to grow and work with innovative and exciting specialists in the industry; Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy, and mentoring, which creates development opportunities, both for you and the company. If you want an exciting challenge, work with some of the coolest technologies and enjoy your time doing it, then join us! Submit your detailed CV in English, quoting reference: ( DESD1222 ). You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our website ( https:www.eurodyn.com ) and following us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) ( https:www.eurodyn.com ) is a leading European Software, Information, and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 800 engineers, IT experts, and consultants (around 3% Ph.D., 36% MSc, and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies, and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents. At Demo SA, one of the world largest pharmaceutical manufacturers in injectable facilities, we are currently looking for a high-performing Data Engineer to join our team. The main purpose of this role is to help us transform raw data into useful data systems. The position is based at Kryoneri (Athens). Responsibilities Design & implement a suitable data infrastructure to enable the organization to analyze and extract business value from data Gather functional & non-functional data analytics requirements from Business Units and translate them into a working design (DWH, ETL, etc.) Design and develop analytical tools to extract valuable insights needed for increasing operational efficiency Design, test and maintain database management systems, data warehouse and build data pipelines Extract patterns in data and implement necessary modifications in the data models used Data analysis and Visualization Ensure data accuracy and integrity Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field Master's degree in Data Analytics or a similar field is an advantage 2+ years’ experience in a Data Analytics, Software engineering, Database management or relevant role Fluency in Greek & English Proficiency in programming languages like Java, Python, Scala, R, C++, C#. Experience with Data Analytics platforms & ETL tools (e.g. Microsoft Power PlatformPower BI, Azure Data Factory & Common Data Model, Qlik, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) In-depth Database management knowledge (SQL and NoSQL Database) Understanding of Machine Learning Algorithms, Data science concepts, Data mining and Data modelling techniques is an advantage Benefits Strong analytical, critical-thinking problem-solving and troubleshooting skills Benefits The company offers competitive remuneration, continuous learning and development opportunities, and a friendly and challenging working environment.

Data Engineer Responsibilities Identify data sources Collect data and source missing data Organize data into usable formats and analyze them to find answers to specific questions Set up data infrastructure Develop, implement and maintain databases Assess quality of data and remove or clean data Generate information and insights from data sets and identify trends and patterns Prepare reports for executive and project teams Create visualizations of data Create live dashboards Requirements 2+ years of experience as a Data Engineer Experience with Python, R , Hadoop Experience with a BI front-end (Tableau, SAP BW) and data warehouse system (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) Experience with SQL based and No SQL based technologies Strong documentation skills Ability to quickly analyze a complex problem and conduct detailed analysis Experience in the configuration and implementation of a data governance solutions such as Master Data Governance tool SAP MDG, Collibra, Informatica etc, will be considered an advantage Excellent written and verbal communication skills Bachelor Degree in relevant field Fluency in English
